Friendly emails are typically informal in tone and emphasize personal relationships, while business emails are more formal and focus on the details of the transaction or task at hand. 

Friendly emails usually do not have subjects and may include greetings, phrases, and emoticons. Business emails typically have subjects, begin with formal salutations, and typically follow a professional writing style. 

Friendly emails also typically end with polite questions or comments that invite a response, while business emails usually end with expectations or other informative statements.

import nltk

# Define function to classify emails
def classify_email_sentiment(email):
 
    # Extract text from email
    text = email['text']
 
    # Tokenize the text
    tokens = nltk.word_tokenize(text)
 
    # Classify the sentiment of the email
    sentiment = nltk.sentiment.util.classify_tweet(tokens)
 
    # Return the sentiment
